catalogue_raissonne: Hagiwara Hideo hanga sakuhin mokuroku 2013, no. 122
creditline: Gift of Mary Anette and David Thompson
inscription: bottom center, in pencil:  Composition P | LRC, in pencil: 1958
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
text: Hagiwara Hideo was fascinated by the texture of wood. In this large series of 26 prints—one for each letter of the English alphabet—he used pieces of driftwood as printing blocks, which he individually colored to make the grain in the wood more visible and stand out.
title: Composition P
